Package it.polimi.ingsw.View.User

Class GuiBoardController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.View.User.GuiInitController
it.polimi.ingsw.View.User.GuiBoardController
All Implemented Interfaces:
UserInterface
public class GuiBoardController
extends GuiInitController
GuiBoardController handles all the gui interactions related with the user's interaction with the Game via the Board.

  • Method Details

    • myPlayer

      protected Player myPlayer()
      Method used to quickly get One's player reference
      Returns:
      the player whose board is opened

    • getResources

      protected void getResources​(boolean initialResources) throws java.io.IOException
      Allows the player to store the resources in his depots, if it has any, by drag-dropping for both the in-game phase and the initial resources. Once there are 0 resources left to store or when the player ends the transaction beforehand the board is reloaded to update the resources shown.
      Parameters:
      initialResources - If the Player gets the initial resources or from other sources
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If there are errors while loading the FXML

    • payResource

      protected void payResource() throws java.io.IOException
      Allows the player to pay what he has to pay by clicking on the resource he wants to pay with. Once what is due is paid the board is reloaded to update the resources shown.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If there's a problem loading the FXML

    • board

      protected void board() throws java.io.IOException
      The board screen
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if there's a problem loading the FXML

    • board

      protected void board​(Player player) throws java.io.IOException
      Method used to view other's board
      Parameters:
      player -
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • activateProduction

      public void activateProduction() throws java.lang.Exception
      This method handles the Activate Production button, by opening the Activate Production screen if the user has the right to or by opening the Production Output otherwise
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • refresh

      protected void refresh()
      Refreshes the board by updating the resource data, the card data and the faith data.

    • getFaithData

      protected java.lang.Object[] getFaithData​(Player player)
      Gets the faith information from the game as an Object[]
      Returns:
      Object[] of faith information, in particular: ‣ faithData[0]: 4 images of the players to display onto the track ‣ faithData[1]: their Row position onto the Faith grid ‣ faithData[2]: their Columns position onto the Faith grid. ‣ faithData[3]: 3 images for the PopeTile data

    • setFaithData

      protected void setFaithData​(java.lang.Object[] faithData)
      Sets the faith data and information onto the grid for it to be shown. Each user is set to a corner of the grid so that up to 4 can be displayed
      Parameters:
      faithData - getFaithData()

    • getResourceData

      protected java.lang.Object[] getResourceData​(Player player)
      Gets the resource data for a given Player
      Parameters:
      player - The player to get the data from
      Returns:
      Object[] as described: ‣ resourceData[0]: Image[10] with all the resource Image information orderly placed [0-5] Warehouse resources, [6-9] LeaderCard resources ‣ resourceData[1]: String[4] with the number of resources stored into the Strongbox ordered as such: coins,shieds,servants,stoned

    • setResourceData

      protected void setResourceData​(java.lang.Object[] resourceData)
      Sets the resourceData onto a Board
      Parameters:
      resourceData - Object[] from getResourceData

    • getCardData

      protected javafx.scene.image.Image[] getCardData​(Player player)
      Gets the card data for a given Player
      Parameters:
      player - The player to get the cards data from
      Returns:
      Image[11] as described: ‣ [0-8] The images of the DevelopmentCards ‣ [9-10] The images of the LeaderCards. If viewing another Player's board with the cards not activated or if One's Leader Card have been discarded the back of the card is shown.

    • setCardData

      protected void setCardData​(javafx.scene.image.Image[] cardData)
      Method used for setting the card data onto One's board.
      Parameters:
      cardData - The Image[] from getCardData
